alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 5:26AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...LATE SEASON SNOWFALL IN THE MOUNTAINS TODAY... Unseasonably cold air has spread across eastern Washington and eastern Oregon. Snow levels will be as low as 3000 feet this afternoon, and snow levels will lower to around 2000 to 3000 feet tonight. The mountains and nearby valleys will observe scattered to numerous snow showers. While snow accumulations will be light for the east side of Washington and Oregon, snow covered roadways will cause travel delays. Travelers need to be prepared for winter driving conditions. Make sure you have blankets, phone chargers, and warm and dry clothing if traveling over the mountains. The Blue Mountains, the Ochoco-John Day Highlands, the higher elevations of Wallowa County, and the east slopes of the Washington and Oregon Cascades will observe 1 to 3 inches of new snow today and tonight. The Cascade crest and the higher peaks of the Wallowa Mountains will receive around 3 to 6 inches. Locally heavier accumulations can be expected if brief heavy snow showers occur. A chance of mountain snow showers is forecast for Monday with light snow accumulations expected.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Northwest Blue Mountains
